text: is there a specific parameter to include in svgs in order to make the filemanager recognize the _proper_ height? It always lists svgs as having the same height as the width
eeesh looks like <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/C22PU4LV8/p1632753900253400|I asked this a year ago> :flushed:

Whelp… I found the issue thanks to <@UBT0AHWLD> showing me a working example of an svg.
In my case svgomg was stripping out the width / height and the svg was only using viewBox. I added width and height back in and now all is wonderful in the world. The editor now has the correct dimentions
Cool! glad you´ve been able to figure it out quickly, though that sounds like a bug on svgomg´s end, i mean, is it wise to only rely on viewBox? That is at least debatetable in my opinion.
nah not a bug. They strip out as much fluff as the dev wants. An svg will work with only viewbox

Hello, how are you guys?

I would like to implement responsive tables in blog posts on HubStop, I tried to apply a Collapse by columns technique but I couldn't with the predefined structure in the post editor. Does anyone know of a way to implement Collapse by columns with the structure of a table inserted with the post editor, without requiring the user to edit a table outside the editor?
